definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: A foreign party is encouraged to deposit in the Bank of China any part of foreign exchange which he is entitled to remit abroad.
sentences.chinese: 鼓勵外國合營者將可匯出的外匯存入中國銀行。

sentences.english: Residents remitting outward funds to redeem his global depository receipts.
sentences.chinese: 居民爲贖回其海外存託憑證所匯出之資金。

sentences.english: Issuance of stocks in the R. O. C. by foreign nationals.
sentences.chinese: 非居民在臺公開發行股票募集資金匯出。

sentences.english: Outward remittances of interest from deposits in R. O. C banks by non-residents.
sentences.chinese: 非居民匯出在國內存款之利息所得。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
(of a sum of money etc) receivable
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
to lend money (for interest)/to give credit
